items.title: Stock Market LIVE Updates: GIFT Nifty signals a negative start; US markets gain, Asia trades lower
items.description: Sensex Today | Stock Market LIVE Updates: Wall Street's main indexes ended higher on Monday, with the small-cap Russell 2000 index hitting an all-time high after Scott Bessent's nomination as U.S. Treasury secretary helped push bond yields lower. The S&P 500 gained 17.81 points, or 0.30%, to end at 5,987.15 points, while the Nasdaq Composite gained 51.50 points, or 0.27%, to 19,055.15. The Dow Jones Industrial Average 439.02 points, or 0.99%, to 44,735.53.

items.title: Agri Picks Report November 26, 2024: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: According to Geojit, Farmers in Gujarat have sown rabi crops across 1.2 million hectares as of Monday, down 42.5% on year from 2.0 million hectares sown in the same period last year, according to a report released by the state agriculture department.

items.title: Live: Will Nifty Rally Pause After 2-Day Surge? FIIs Turn Buyers After 38 Sessions| Opening Bell
items.description:
The Indian equity market continued the previous session's rally and ended on a strong note on November 25 with Nifty above 24,200 after the BJP-led Mahayuti alliance secured a clear mandate in the Maharashtra elections. At close, the Sensex was up 992.74 points or 1.25 percent at 80,109.85, and the Nifty was up 314.60 points or 1.32 percent at 24,221.90.

On the back of positive global cues, the Indian indices opened a gap-up on November 25 with Nifty around 24,250 and extended the gain in the first half. Foreign institutional investors turned net buyers for the first time in 38 sessions. This morning global cues are mixed and the GIFT Nifty is hinting at a muted but negative start. Among stocks in news – watch out for HUL, HDFC Life, Shree Cement among others. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Ajit Mishra - SVP, Research, Religare Broking and Kunal Shah, Senior Research Analyst, Carnelian Capital

items.title: Is the IPO party over? Nearly 40% of 2024 entrants dip below issue price
items.description: Data shows that more than two dozen companies that made their debut on the bourses in the current calendar year have fallen below their respective issue prices following a market correction that began in October. More importantly, the list includes companies that made a stellar debut in terms of listing day gains.

items.title: Vodafone Idea skyrockets 15% as cabinet likely clears bank guarantee waiver for telcos
items.description: Indian telecom operators, primarily Bharti Airtel and Vodafone Idea, collectively bear over Rs 30,000 crore in bank guarantee obligations.

items.title: Nifty, Sensex extend gains for third-day as IT, realty stocks rally
items.description: All sectoral indices traded in the positive with Nifty and Realty rising over a percent each. A sharp rise in realty stocks comes after Jefferies said it remains optimistic about the real estate sector, citing a six-month high in residential sales during October

items.title: Accumulate Maruti Suzuki India Ltd; target of Rs 14250: Asit C Mehta
items.description: Asit C Mehta recommended Accumulate rating on Maruti Suzuki India Ltd with a target price of Rs 14250 in its research report dated November 19 2024.

items.title: JPMorgan sees ER&D growth revival in 2025 but telecom challenges to cap valuation upside
items.description: The brokerage's preferred ranking for ER&D stocks places KPIT Tech and Persistent at the forefront, followed by L&T Tech, Cyient, Tata Elxsi, and Tata Tech.

items.title: Swiggy shares rise 6% as UBS initiates coverage with 'buy', 26% upside seen
items.description: UBS says that in the online food delivery (OFD) segment, Swiggy is narrowing the gap with Zomato in terms of margins and scale.

items.title: Sagility India stock surges 8% after strong Q2 earnings show
items.description: Just two weeks after its market debut, Sagility India released its quarterly earnings which marked double-digit growth across key parameters of profit, revenue and profitability.

items.title: Krystal Integrated shares rise 4% on securing Rs 106-crore deal
items.description: The three-year contract, with an option for annual renewal, involves providing comprehensive attendant manpower services for BMC's Education and Security Departments.

items.title: Emcure Pharmaceuticals stock rises 10% as Kotak upgrades to 'add', sees 28% upside
items.description: Kotak anticipates a pickup in organic growth, a positive outlook for the second half, and robust medium-term prospects.

items.title: ACME Solar shares drop 7.5% as net profit takes a dive in Q2
items.description: The monetisation of operational assets in the second half of FY24 created a high base for ACME Solar Holdings, triggering a fall in profit and revenue in Q2 FY25.

items.title: Heavy trading volumes lifts Tata Teleservices shares 13% higher
items.description: Strong buying across the telecom sector, following the Union Cabinet's approval of the bank guarantee waiver for telcos, also boosted sentiment for Tata Teleservices.

items.title: Route Mobile rises over 3%, the most in 15 weeks amid heavy volumes
items.description: So far on November 26, around 58,000 equity shares exchanged on both BSE and NSE

items.title: Mid-day | Nifty, Sensex pare gains, trade lower as auto, energy stocks slip; IT, metals strong
items.description: Nifty Auto, Energy and Pharma index slipped the most in the afternoon. Losses in big names like M&M, Maruti Suzuki, Tata Motors, and Bajaj Auto dragged the auto index lower.

items.title: Karur Vysya Bank — good quality at reasonable valuation
items.description: Negligible exposure to unsecured may help the bank to throw up positive surprises

items.title: Triveni Turbine stock soars to record high; surges 27.5% in two sessions
items.description: The strong buying activity in Triveni Turbine shares was driven by a sharp surge trading volumes, fueled by the company's promising growth prospects.

items.title: Bharat Global continues bull run, shares hit 5% upper circuit on Rs 156 crore order
items.description: Today marked the 18th consecutive session that Bharat Global shares were locked in a 5 percent upper circuit. So far in November, the stock has surged by nearly 120 percent.

items.title: Live: Nifty Pauses After 900-Point Rally In 2 Sessions But Holds 24,200| Swiggy Surges| Closing Bell
items.description:
Bulls pause for breath after solid two-day surge. Nifty around 24,200 amid volatility. Broader markets fare better; smallcaps outperform. Market breadth in favour of gainers. Autos & pharma among laggards today. IT & FMCG among pockets that saw buying.
Join Nandita Khemka and Yatin Mota as they break down the key stocks to watch and discuss insights on market performance trends and sectoral movements.

items.title: Taking Stock: Market snaps two-day gains, closes marginally lower amid volatility
items.description: Mixed trend was seen on the sectoral front, with auto, power, pharma, oil & gas sectors closing 1-1.5 percent lower, while FMCG, IT, metal sectors closed 0.5-1 percent higher

items.title: Absence of fresh triggers, weakness in auto, pharma stocks drag Nifty, Sensex lower
items.description: The mid and smallcap indices, also known as the broader market, outperformed the benchmarks and posted gains of 0.1 and 0.6 percent, respectively.

items.title: Gainers & Losers: Stocks that moved the most on November 26
items.description: The market slipped back into the red after enjoying two days of strong gains as investors cheered for the BJP's landslide win in Maharashtra. Looking ahead, analysts feel valuations, FII selling and earnings growth will remain the key driver for market sentiment.
